      • getJavaProjectDirectory

        public abstract java.lang.String getJavaProjectDirectory()
        Get the Java project directory, with the Java source etc. underneath it. This directory can then be used to locate test data files, etc.
        Returns:
        project directory

      • assertEquals

        public void assertEquals(@Nullable
                         java.lang.Object expected,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.Object actual)
        Asserts that two objects are equal. If they are not, a test framework assertion error without a message is thrown. If expected and actual are null, they are considered equal.
        Parameters:
        expected - expected value
        actual - the value to check against expected

      • assertEquals

        public abstract void assertEquals(@Nullable
                                  java.lang.String message,
                                  @Nullable
                                  java.lang.Object expected,
                                  @Nullable
                                  java.lang.Object actual)
        Asserts that two objects are equal. If they are not, a test framework assertion error is thrown with the given message. If expected and actual are null, they are considered equal.
        Parameters:
        message - the identifying message for the assertion error (null okay)
        expected - expected value
        actual - actual value

      • assertEquals

        public void assertEquals(long expected,
                         long actual)
        Asserts that two longs are equal. If they are not, a test framework assertion error is thrown.
        Parameters:
        expected - expected long value.
        actual - actual long value

      • assertEquals

        public void assertEquals(@Nullable
                         java.lang.String message,

        Asserts that two longs are equal. If they are not, a test framework assertion error is thrown with the given message.

        expected - long expected value.
        actual - long actual value

      • assertArrayEquals

        public abstract void assertArrayEquals(@Nullable
                                       java.lang.String message,
                                       java.lang.Object[] expecteds,
                                       java.lang.Object[] actuals)
        Asserts that two object arrays are equal. If they are not, a test framework assertion error is thrown with the given message. If expecteds and actuals are null, they are considered equal.
        Parameters:
        message - the identifying message for the test framework assertion error (null okay)
        expecteds - Object array or array of arrays (multi-dimensional array) with expected values.
        actuals - Object array or array of arrays (multi-dimensional array) with actual values

      • assertArrayEquals

        public void assertArrayEquals(java.lang.Object[] expecteds,
                              java.lang.Object[] actuals)
        Asserts that two object arrays are equal. If they are not, a test framework assertion error is thrown. If expected and actual are null, they are considered equal.
        Parameters:
        expecteds - Object array or array of arrays (multi-dimensional array) with expected values
        actuals - Object array or array of arrays (multi-dimensional array) with actual values

        condition - condition to be checked

        object - Object to check or null

      • assertSame

        public abstract void assertSame(java.lang.String message,
                                @Nullable
                                java.lang.Object expected,
                                @Nullable
                                java.lang.Object actual)
        Asserts that two objects refer to the same object. If they are not, a test frame assertion error is thrown with the given message
        Parameters:
        message - the identifying message for the test framework assertion error (null okay)
        expected - the expected object
        actual - the object to compare to expected
